Part 1: Enzymatic DNA Synthesis (TdT-mediated)

    Step 1.1: Perform Coupling Reaction for Nucleotide Addition

        Option 1.1.1: TdT-mediated addition of a 3'-O-blocked nucleotide terminator.
            - Component A: Immobilized initiator oligonucleotide on beads (final concentration: 1 µM)
            - Component B: ZaTdT-R335L-K337G (final concentration: 2 mg/mL)
            - Component C: 3′-ONH2-dATP (final concentration: 0.50 mM)
            - Component D: CoCl2 (final concentration: 0.50 mM)
            - Component E: Phosphate buffer (pH 6.8) (final concentration: 50 mM)
            - Component F: NaCl (final concentration: 100 mM)
            (operational details: All components are prepared with HPLC-grade water and must be free from aldehyde/ketone contamination. The reaction mixture is incubated at 30 °C for 5 minutes with gentle tilting and rotation to keep beads suspended.)

    Step 1.2: Perform Post-Coupling Wash

        Option 1.2.1: Wash beads using 1X Binding & Washing (B&W) Buffer.
            - Component A: Beads from the coupling step
            - Component B: 1X Binding & Washing (B&W) Buffer
                - Recipe: 5 mM Tris-HCl (pH 7.5), 0.5 mM EDTA, 1 M NaCl, 0.1% Tween-20
            (operational details: Use a magnetic stand to separate the beads for 1 minute and remove the supernatant. Add 1X B&W Buffer, resuspend the beads, separate them again on the magnetic stand, and discard the supernatant. Repeat this wash cycle 2-3 times.)

    Step 1.3: Perform Deblocking Reaction

        Option 1.3.1: Cleavage of the 3′-ONH2 protecting group with sodium nitrite.
            - Component A: Washed beads from the post-coupling wash
            - Component B: Cleavage Reagent
                - Recipe: 700 mM NaNO2 in 1 M aqueous sodium acetate buffer, pH 5.5
            (operational details: Resuspend the beads in the Cleavage Reagent and incubate at room temperature for 5 minutes with gentle rotation. This step may be repeated to ensure complete cleavage.)

    Step 1.4: Perform Post-Deblocking Wash

        Option 1.4.1: Wash beads using 1X Binding & Washing (B&W) Buffer.
            - Component A: Beads from the deblocking step
            - Component B: 1X Binding & Washing (B&W) Buffer
                - Recipe: 5 mM Tris-HCl (pH 7.5), 0.5 mM EDTA, 1 M NaCl, 0.1% Tween-20
            (operational details: Use a magnetic stand to separate the beads for 1 minute and remove the deblocking buffer. Add 1X B&W Buffer, resuspend the beads, separate them again, and discard the supernatant. Repeat this wash cycle 2-3 times.)

    Step 1.5: Initiate Subsequent Synthesis Cycles

        Option 1.5.1: Repeat synthesis cycle for the next nucleotide in the sequence.
            - Component A: Washed, deblocked beads from previous cycle
            - Component B: 3′-ONH2-dCTP, 3′-ONH2-dATP, 3′-ONH2-dTTP, or 3′-ONH2-dGTP (as required by the target sequence)
            - Component C: All other components for the coupling reaction as described in Option 1.1.1.
            (operational details: Repeat Steps 1.1 through 1.4, using the appropriate 3′-ONH2-dNTP for the current position in the desired DNA sequence.)
 The validated procedure has been saved to the file: Protocol-c2dc
